title: Los Freddy's "Sin Tu Amor" LP (vinyl rip)
description:
This is very old vinyl rip of Los Freddy&#039;s 
"Sin Tu Amor" LP from 1969 (?). This LP is 
long OUT-OF-PRINT and was one of my 1st 
attempts at rippin vinyl in 1997.

Quality isn&#039;t great, my family must have 
played this LP nearly 10,000 times before
1980 (!), but it&#039;s now available to any one 
who is interested, or fondly remembers early 
60&#039;s to early 70&#039;s Mexican garage rock &#039;n roll.

"Sin Tu Amor" contains a couple of spanish 
sung cover tunes. "Sin Tu Amor" is a cover of
Englbert Humperdincks&#039; "The Way It Used To Be";
"Muere La Ilusion" is Classic IV&#039;s "Traces" 
and "Cansado" is "Groovin&#039;" by The Rascals.

Enjoy!!

Also available are the follow out-of-print
Los Freddy&#039;s LP&#039;s:

Mato Mi Corazon (1967?)
Obsesion (1968?)
Sin Tu Amor (1969?)
Lagrimas Son (1970?)
Con Tu Adios (1972)
Quiero Ser Feliz (1973)
Llegara Tu Final (1974)
Aquel Amor (1975)

If you want them...ask.
